text: On the subject of work experience, it's a good concept but it will greatly differ between companies and how they manage you. It would seem based on what you've said that landing a paid role seems to be your priority. I also think that's the ideal outcome. Going back quickly to the fact you initially spoke about freelancing, I'd say that freelancing most certainly has its pros and cons. I know a few very experienced freelancers and they all seem to be very happy with the work life balance that's seemingly always superior to that of a full time employee not to mention the fact you'll always earn more as you have to charge more to cover the fact you must own your own equipment, licenses, a lack of company healthcare or other perks etc. It's something I can definitely give you an insight into but it would be via asking the freelancers I know so there would be a bit of a delay but if you do ever want to know more then ask away :slightly_smiling_face:

my pleasure, digest it all and feel free to get back to me whenever it suits you :slightly_smiling_face: I'd say that making your own website isn't necessary but if you want to do it and that makes you happy then by all means go for it.
